intro: Psychotria principensis, commonly known as the "Crimson Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the understory of humid forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to deep red. It produces small, red berries that are an important food source for various wildlife species. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
